text:
>  We have a wallet using external signing.
I assume you are right now building a CC wallet, correct?

Consider building a wallet that can use all token standard assets as a next iteration.
> 
> We want to encourage usage by having a way to earn app reward when people using our wallet, and share this reward back to user.
Good call. Ideally, you use the featured app activity markers API (<https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/daml_api/index.html#featured-app-activity-markers-api-cip-0047>) to create the records. You can share some part of the app rewards directly with the user by listing them as a beneficiary: <https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-featured-app-v1/Splice-Api-FeaturedAppRightV1.html#type-splice-api-featuredapprightv1-featuredapprightcreateactivitymarker-36646|https://docs.dev.sync.global/app_dev/api/splice-api-featured-app-v1/Splice-Api-FeaturedAppRightV1.html#type-splice-api-featu[]eactivitymarker-36646>

So that leaves us with the challenge of how to create the featured app activity marker as part of the wallet usage. I'll get to that in the follow-up message.
> 
> But in featured app, the recipient provider got the reward.
> 
> So say Alice -> Bob. Bob's provider party got reward, and we cannot control Bob.
> 
> So our plan is having a "fee" tx of 0.01 CC for example, where Alice send to our featurd party 0.01CC. SO that it can mint reward.
I'd avoid this route, as it assumes the users have CC available; and are willing to spend it explicitly. Much better to go via the featured app activity markers.

attachments.text:
### Problem

 featured wallet providers and others interacting with token standard choices would like to create featured app activity markers as part of calling these choices
 when using external signing they cannot do so via submitting multiple commands, as prepared transactions with multiple root nodes are not yet supported

### Solution Approach

 build Daml library as part of splice that wraps every choice of the token standard APIs jointly with the ability to create a featured app marker with specific beneficiaries
 consider what it would take to install this library by default on every validator node

#### Details

I expect the core construction to look about as follows:

```
template TokenStandardProxy with
    provider : Party
  where
    signatory provider

    nonconsuming choice TokenStandardProxy_TransferFactory_Transfer 
      : ProxyResult TransferFactory_TransferResult
      with
        featureAppRightCid : ContractId FeaturedAppRight
        markerArg : FeaturedAppRight_CreateActivityMarker
        factoryCid : ContractId TranserFactory
        choiceArg : TransferFactory_Transfer
      controller choiceArg.transfer.sender
      do 
        appRight <- fetch featuredAppRightCid
        require "appRight.provider matches" (appRight.provider == provider)
        exercise featuredAppRightCid markerArg 
        exercise factoryCid choiceArg

data ProxyResult r = ProxyResult with
    markerResult : FeaturedAppRight_CreateActivityMarkerResult
    choiceResult : r

```

The idea being that a wallet app provider creates one proxy contract themselves and uses explicit disclosure when preparing the transaction for the user.
